Title: Prove $|a+b|+|a-b| \geq |a|+|b|$
Content: I am fighting with this proof-writing problem for a while. The statement says $$|a+b|+|a-b| \geq |a|+|b|.$$ I know the triangle inequality which says$$|a+b| \leq |a|+|b|.$$ How can I use this inequality to prove the statement above? I am adding the distance between $a$ and $b$ to $|a+b|$ which then turns the triangle inequality to another direction. How can I prove this in a mathematical way?
AcceptedAnswer: $2|a|=|a+b+a-b|\leq |a+b|+|a-b|$ $2|b|=|b+a+b-a|\leq |b+a|+|b-a|=|a+b|+|a-b|$ Add these inequalities and then halve.
